title: Healthy Vegetable Stir Fry Recipe for Kids and Toddlers
content:
This is a great dish to include veggies in your little one's diet. You can add whatever veggies you like in this. The addition of nuts powder in this makes it more tasty and healthy for your kids. You can serve this with rice or use it as a filling in paratha or use it as a filling for roti rolls.

 

Preparation Time: 5 mins

Cooking Time: 10 mins

Serves: 2

 

Ingredients:

 

Vegetables of your choice (i used carrots, beans, and spring onions) – 1 cup

Ghee – 2 tsp

Cumin Seeds / Jeerakam – 1/2 teaspoon(optional)

Salt to taste

Pepper to taste

Sugar – 1/4 tsp

Powdered Nuts – 2 tablespoon ( i used cashew, badam and walnuts will work too)

Coriander leaves – 1 tablespoon finely chopped

 

 

Method:

Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin and let them sizzle.

Add in veggies and mix well. Cook them for 5 mins or so.

Add in salt, sugar, and pepper and mix well.

Add in nuts powders and mix well.

Finally, add in coriander leaves and give a good mix.

Serve with rice
